com.google.inject.tools.suite.module
Interface ModuleRepresentation

public interface ModuleRepresentation

Representation of a module context in the user's code.

Author:
Darren Creutz (dcreutz@gmail.com)

Method Summary
 RunModuleSnippet clean(CodeRunner codeRunner)
          Tell the module to clean itself (run itself).
 java.util.Set<? extends ModuleSnippet.ConstructorRepresentation> getConstructors()
          Return all the constructors the module has.
 java.lang.String getName()
          Return the name of this module.
 boolean hasDefaultConstructor()
          Return true if the module has a default (no argument) constructor.
 boolean isDirty()
          Return true if the module is dirty, i.e.
 void makeDirty()
          Mark the module as dirty.
 

Method Detail

getName

java.lang.String getName()
Return the name of this module.

Returns:
the module name

hasDefaultConstructor

boolean hasDefaultConstructor()
Return true if the module has a default (no argument) constructor.

getConstructors

java.util.Set<? extends ModuleSnippet.ConstructorRepresentation> getConstructors()
Return all the constructors the module has.

isDirty

boolean isDirty()
Return true if the module is dirty, i.e. has changed since it was last run.

makeDirty

void makeDirty()
Mark the module as dirty. This is called by the ModuleManager in response to the ModulesSource.

clean

RunModuleSnippet clean(CodeRunner codeRunner)
Tell the module to clean itself (run itself). NOTE: The runnable returned will not actually be run until the client calls .run() on it.

Parameters:
codeRunner - the CodeRunner to run the ModuleSnippet with.
